ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: How to stop filtering of already seen URIs based on previous fetch status code?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... If you pause a crawl, towards the base of the index.jsp console page appears View or Edit Frontier URIs .  Click here.  Allows adding/deleting URIs

astar_t wrote:
>
> Hi again, actually upon further analysis, you are right, the URI I
> had force fed into the crawler via JMX did indeed eventually get
> crawled. When I took a look at the frontier report it was placed in
> queue but I didn't see it in the crawl.log for a while so figured it
> had been skipped. It must have just taken a while to get crawled or
> show up in the log.
>
> While on the topic, I'm wondering is there a way to do this type of
> force feeding of URIs via the Heritrix GUI or profile settings? The
> method I use for this currently is with a script that greps out URIs
> in the crawl.log then feeds the matches to the crawler via JMX
> commands. This does work out okay, but I'm curious if there is maybe
> another way that is built into Heritrix somewhere (?)
>













If you pause a crawl, towards the base of the index.jsp console page 
appears 'View or Edit Frontier URIs'.  Click here.  Allows 
adding/deleting URIs to/from Frontier.
St.Ack




>
> Thanks again for the help !
> Adam
>
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
> <mailto:archive-crawler%40yahoogroups.com>, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...>
> wrote:
> >
> > astar_t wrote:
> > > Hi, I'm running a crawl where initially some URIs were rejected
> by a
> > > DecideRule that was added by mistake. So the URIs show up in the
> > > crawl.log as having a -5000 fetch code. However, I have realized
> that
> > > I would actually like to crawl a subset of these URIs that have
> already
> > > been rejected.
> > >
> > > So I tried to import the URIs back into the frontier with force
> fetch
> > > via JMX cmdline but they are not being fetched. I'm assuming
> this is
> > > because they are "already seen" URIs so the BdbUriUniqFilter is
> > > ignoring them.
> > >
> > > Is there a way I can force Heritrx to retry a fetch of the URIs
> that
> > > previously had a -5000 code ?
> >
> > As Stack notes, this should work. The 'force-fetch' flag means to
> ignore
> > the already-included status. However, it doesn't ignore scoping --
> are
> > you sure the URIs, as added, would be ruled in-scope?
> >
> > (Are they appearing anywhere after your force-fetch add -- in the
> > frontier report, in the crawl.log, etc.?)
> >
> > - Gordon @ IA
> >
>
>
